item.description:
Go for a hike, learn about wild mushrooms, and enjoy some great Gloucester music and ale!

We'll be joining a Boston-based club in a group mushroom hunt. After heading out in groups to forage, everyone will bring their finds back to a table for ID and discussion.

Ravenswood Park boasts 10 miles of (mostly flat) hiking and carriage trails, moss-covered boulders, a magnolia swamp boardwalk trail, and a scenic overlook of Gloucester Harbor. This is a 600-acre Trustees of Reservations forest preserve with remnants of early colonial and Native-American settlement.

And it's a truly beautiful park with boardwalks and birds. We've seen some very loud and conspicuous red-bellied and pileated woodpeckers working trailside snags, undisturbed as we watched. And there's a nature center staffed by the gracious and informative, Ramona.

Afterward we'll head to Gloucester for a pint & a bite at one or two of several great pubs. Cape Ann Brewing has Pumpkin Ale - and live music beginning at 5 pm!

There's an interesting downtown area to walk around with shops and restaurants, as well as rich history to explore.

**Parking is limited. Please carpool & share expenses with your driver.

Portsmouth Carpool: 11:15 am @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Rd. Meet in the back of the carpool lot.

Newburyport Carpool: 11:30 am. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95. Meet in the back of the lot. (Post a comment if you want to meet here.)

Please note: the group we're joining has an additional $5 membership fee if you want to join them permanently, but it's not required your first time out with them.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers.

*Consumption of wild mushrooms is at your own risk. I make no claims of any expertise on the subject!

Participation in this activity is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Mushroom Hunt with Music and Beer!
